Honestly, I don't know what kind of payloads Damion's put into orbit, but ever since I started using more and more mods and building massive space stations and lander habitation module things that are pretty much nothing but dead weight, I have a hard time making a small ship because it's just too damn easy to pilot. It's a delicate dance between barely thrusting to give myself enough to turn (I hardly use RCS and SAS anymore), maintaining the correct degree of attack, time, and not raising my AP any more than I want to.

I've already done the whole tiny craft thing - those were the first kinds of rockets that I built. After I sat down and learning to do things properly (like optimizing my gravity turns, injection phases, etc.) and understood why I was doing them , efficient design became pretty boring and monotonous. After venturing into mods (because the design capabilities for stock parts plateaus pretty quickly) I started making pretty big space stations and habitation capsules to land on the moons. It's quite more challenging to pilot a giant craft with 20 KMU's of dead weight strapped to the top of it (not counting the weight of the engines and fuel powering the thing) when you neglect to add RCS to it because RCS just makes things too easy. I design them to get into final descent stage not using any of the on board fuel as a bit of an additional challenge.

Tiny, efficient rockets and landers are boring for me now. I just continue to make things more and more complex and more difficult to pilot and land because its the only thing challenging anymore. My next little self-made challenge is a craft that can get to and return from the Mun using nothing but SRBs (from mods as well as stock) and then the same thing to Minmus, a massive rover/mobile base powered by the Katerpillar wheels and constructed with Kosmos parts, and fixing up my drop pod design so it uses more SRBs and feels more automated. I've gotten to the point where as long as it has enough fuel, I can pretty much pilot anything, big or small, into space, landing, and return, so the only way for me to make the game more difficult is to strap on more dead weight, make it less manageable to control, and make it more complex.
